FL.name: Florida

summary.demand: High demand in metro hubs and coastal markets; seasonal spikes in winter.
summary.unionization: Low union density overall; pockets of unionized facilities.
summary.growth: Population growth driven; sustained demand in acute + outpatient settings.
summary.seasonality: Snowbird season increases census and travel demand.

compensation.signOn: Sign-on packages vary by specialty and facility.
benefitsNotes: Benefits vary by system; confirm retirement match and PTO accrual.

licensing.endorsementTime: Compact license holders can start immediately; endorsement timelines vary.
licensing.feeRange: Check state BON for current fees.
notes: Compact state: multistate license is accepted.
Verify any local facility credentialing timelines.

drivers: Aging population and high seasonal influx.
riskNotes: Hurricane season impacts staffing and relocation.

systems.name: HCA Florida Healthcare
systems.notes: High facility count; mix of metro and suburban.

competition.agencyPresence: High travel agency competition in metro markets.

pipeline.programCountEstimate: Large statewide pipeline; confirm from programs data.
residencies: Large systems run multi-cohort nurse residency programs.
Academic centers offer specialty fellowship tracks.
clinicalPartners: Academic medical centers with large clinical rotations.

pros: No state income tax; higher take-home pay.
Large system footprints allow multiple placement options.
High demand in ICU, ED, and perioperative specialties.
Weather and lifestyle attract candidates from colder climates.
cons: Coastal rent and insurance costs can be high.
Hurricane season creates relocation and staffing risk.
Competition from travel agencies can drive pay pressure.
Staffing ratios vary widely by facility.
attractions: Year-round warm climate, beaches, and outdoor recreation.
Diverse metro markets (Miami, Orlando, Tampa, Jacksonville).
drawbacks: Hurricane preparedness costs and relocation planning.
High auto/home insurance in some counties.
Seasonal rental demand in peak months.
talkingPoints: {homeState} teams are hiring {specialty} RNs right now with relocation support from {targetState}.
We can fast-track a move from {targetState} to {homeState} using your {license} status and a {timeline} start window.
We prioritize {homeState} hospitals with strong onboarding and lower WARN risk across {shift} schedules.
We can target pay bands near {targetPay} and match you to the best {metro} fit in {homeState}.

objections.concern: I like Florida weather and lifestyle
objections.response: We will position {homeState} as a career growth move with comparable pay, stable schedules, and metro options that match your lifestyle priorities.

objections.concern: I am worried about moving costs
objections.response: We focus on systems with relocation stipends, sign-on bonuses, and start-date flexibility so the move from {targetState} to {homeState} is financially manageable.

objections.concern: I need a day shift only
objections.response: We will filter to day-shift openings in {homeState} first and align a realistic {timeline}.

clinicRegistry.name: Cleveland Clinic Florida (Outpatient & Specialty)
clinicRegistry.notes: Specialty clinics tied to Cleveland Clinic Florida.

clinicRegistry.name: Baptist Health Miami Cancer Institute
clinicRegistry.notes: Specialty cancer center with national recognition.

clinicRegistry.name: AdventHealth Medical Group (Orlando)
clinicRegistry.notes: Flagship ambulatory network in Central Florida.

clinicRegistry.name: UF Health Shands Clinics
clinicRegistry.notes: Academic specialty clinics tied to UF Health.

candidateInsights.title: Model inputs
candidateInsights.detail: Grad output 4,100 (brain drain 40%), healthcare ratio 1.80%, relocation preference 28%.

candidateInsights.title: Estimated Indiana-educated RN pool in Florida

IN.name: Indiana

summary.demand: Moderate demand with strong opportunities in Indianapolis metro and regional hubs; rural areas face chronic shortages.
summary.unionization: Low union density statewide; some union presence in Northwest Indiana near Chicago.
summary.growth: Steady growth driven by aging population and healthcare system expansion; IU Health continues consolidation.
summary.seasonality: Minimal seasonal variation; consistent year-round demand.

compensation.signOn: Sign-on bonuses range $5,000-25,000 for critical specialties.
benefitsNotes: Lower cost of living offsets moderate base pay.
Major systems offer strong retirement matches (4-6%).
Tuition reimbursement common across IU Health, Ascension, Community.

licensing.endorsementTime: Compact license holders can start immediately; endorsement typically 2-4 weeks.
notes: Indiana Board of Nursing processes applications efficiently.

drivers: IU Health system expansion and facility consolidation.
Aging Hoosier population increasing chronic care needs.
Rural hospital closures driving demand to regional centers.
Growing ambulatory surgery and outpatient footprint.
riskNotes: Rural facility closures affecting some regions.
Medicaid reimbursement challenges for smaller systems.
Competition from Ohio and Illinois border markets.

systems.name: IU Health
systems.notes: 18 hospitals, dominant market share, academic partner with IU School of Medicine.

systems.name: Ascension St. Vincent
systems.notes: 11 hospitals statewide; strong ER and cardiac programs.

systems.name: Community Health Network
systems.notes: 7 hospitals focused on Indianapolis metro; known for employee experience.

systems.name: Parkview Health
systems.notes: Regional leader with 55% market share in Fort Wayne.

systems.name: Deaconess Health
systems.notes: Tri-state regional system; 60% Evansville market share.

systems.name: Beacon Health System
systems.notes: Major South Bend employer; Michigan border access.

competition.agencyPresence: Moderate travel agency presence; strongest in Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.
competition.privateEquity: Limited PE activity; most systems are nonprofit.

hospitalRegistry.name: Indiana University Health La Porte Hospital

residencies: IU Health operates the state's largest nurse residency program.
Ascension St. Vincent offers specialty residency tracks.
Parkview and Community Health have competitive residency programs.
clinicalPartners: Major health systems provide clinical rotations for all nursing schools.
Strong academic partnerships between IU Health and IU School of Nursing.

pros: Low cost of living with competitive healthcare wages.
Strong IU Health academic medical center pipeline.
Major systems offer excellent benefits and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Lower base wages compared to coastal states.
Rural hospital closures affecting some regions.
Limited large-metro nightlife compared to coastal cities.
attractions: Low cost of living enables higher savings rate.
Four distinct seasons; close to Midwest cities.
Strong college sports culture (IU, Purdue, Notre Dame).
drawbacks: Less outdoor recreation than coastal states.
Winter weather from November through March.
